Title.evidence: This review investigated the effectiveness of interventions aimed at reducing opioid use in patients after orthopaedic surgery.

Intervention.evidence: The mean daily dose was lower with multimodal analgesia interventions than with placebo/no intervention/usual care or active control in the medium term.

Objective.evidence: This review investigated the effectiveness of interventions aimed at reducing opioid use in patients after orthopaedic surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the mean daily dose of opioid analgesic medications in the medium term (1–3 months after randomisation).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean daily dose was lower with multimodal analgesia interventions than with placebo/no intervention/usual care or active control in the medium term.
